publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Oswego

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by Kathryn Johns-Masten
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: The bonds represented in the collection were granted to aid the Oswego Midland Railroad Company, the Lake Shore Railroad Company, and the Syracuse, Phoenix, and Oswego Railroad Company. Numerous towns and cities participated in issuing these bonds including: Oswego, Richland, Sandy Creek, Schroeppel, Hannibal and Constantia. The most impressive part of this collection are the fine imprints of the bonds.

repository.corpname: State University of New York at Oswego

accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to the public.

bioghist.p: Oswego County communities granted bonds in the middle and late 19th century for the construction of railroads through their towns and cities. The towns and cities also granted the issuing of bonds to support community projects and construction.

controlaccess.corpname: Syracuse, Phoenix and Oswego Railroad Company
controlaccess.subject: Bonds--New York [State]--Oswego County
Railroads--New York [State]--Oswego County--Finance
Bonds
Railroads--United States--Finance

scopecontent.p: The bonds represented in the collection were granted to aid the Oswego Midland Railroad Company, the Lake Shore Railroad Company, and the Syracuse, Phoenix, and Oswego Railroad Company. Numerous towns and cities participated in issuing these bonds including: Oswego, Richland, Sandy Creek, Schroeppel, Hannibal and Constantia. The most impressive part of this collection are the fine imprints of the bonds.

userestrict.p: Please contact SUNY Oswego Archives and Special Collections for use restrictions.

scopecontent.p:
Bonds granted by Oswego County communities in aid of the New York and Oswego Midland Railroad Company, 1868: Constantia, Hastings, Volney and West Monroe. (4 items)
Bonds granted by Oswego County communities in aid of the Lake Ontario Shore Railroad Company, 1885, 1890: Hannibal (5); Oswego (3); packet (7 items).
Bonds for certains towns in Oswego County: Constantia, 1888 (1); Richland, 1870 (1); Sandy Creek, 1870 (1); Schroepel, 1882 (1). (4 items)
Refunding Bonds of the City of Oswego, 1894, 1897. (7 items)
